quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Standard Classes[/h1]

Ruby provides a number of standard built-in classes that make our life a lot easier by providing useful methods for manipulating data. 
Some of the classes in previous lessons include [b]Array[/b], [b]String [/b]and [b]Struct[/b].
Another useful class is the [b]Math [/b]class, which provides methods to perform mathematical operations.
[b]For example: [/b] [code format="rb" codeId="1086"]# square root
puts Math.sqrt(9) # 3

# pi constant
puts Math::PI

# trigonometry (sin, cos, tan)
puts Math::cos(0) # 1[/code]

[h1]Time[/h1]

The [b]Time [/b]class represents dates and times in Ruby. [code format="rb" codeId="1087"]# current time
t = Time.now
puts t

# year, month, day
puts t.year
puts t.month
puts t.day

# custom date
t = Time.new(1988, 6, 10)

# day of week: 0 is Sunday
puts t.wday

# day of year
puts t.yday[/code]
